trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="8e3cee3a-7757-4824-857e-17ed7c1bf27d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="8e3cee3a-7757-4824-857e-17ed7c1bf27d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Storage Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You create an Azure storage linked service to link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You create an Azure storage linked service to link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes syntax for defining an <embeddedLabel>Azure Storage</embeddedLabel> linked service in a JSON file.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes syntax for defining an <embeddedLabel>Azure Storage</embeddedLabel> linked service in a JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureStorage</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureStorage</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.

trans-unit.source: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal
